page.title: 04FARMING (1)
page.content: DEER FARMING In our area there is a deer farm. When we went to visit the farm we found out the following information. Mr MacDonald the farmer wanted to start deer farming because it was not going to be too expensive as he already had the land for the deer to graze. He has been red deer farming for one year now and the deer are being bred for the butcher or for selling to other farmers,who also feel that deer farming would be profitable. In May 1985 the deer are six months old and they are getting antlers. There are 80 deer on the farm and by next year Mr MacDonald hopes to have about 150.The deer are fed on nuts and hay in the winter and grass in the summer.
